item.title: Image Warping and Morphing
item.description: This is related to the 13th lecture of CSCE411 from tamu: http://faculty.cs.tamu.edu/jchai/csce441_spring13/lectures.html Image warpings are basically mappings in spatial domain. As introduced in the Selziski book, fundamental transformations include: similarity, affine, perspective transformations. Beside, we can irregularly warp images using control points, therefore, we have to study optimal sampling/interpolation methods. As an application, image morphing interpolate two images (after correspondences are found).
